meanings.definition: The main stem of a tree.
meanings.sent1: The trunks of the trees in the forest were tall and sturdy.
meanings.sent2: The squirrel climbed up the trunk of the tree to reach its nest.
meanings.sent3: The trunks of the trees danced in the wind, swaying gracefully.
meanings.sent4: The trunk of the tree stood like a giant pillar in the middle of the clearing.
meanings.sent5: The thick trunk of the oak tree was a sight to behold, showing its age and strength.

meanings.definition: A large, strong box used for storing clothes or other items.
meanings.sent1: She packed her winter clothes in the old trunk in the attic.
meanings.sent2: The antique trunk in the living room held many family heirlooms.
meanings.sent3: The trunk in the bedroom was so full of clothes, it refused to close.
meanings.sent4: The trunk served as a treasure chest, holding precious memories within.
meanings.sent5: The heavy trunk was carried carefully down the stairs, filled with books and toys.

meanings.definition: The elongated, flexible snout of an elephant.
meanings.sent1: The elephant used its trunk to pick up a peanut from the ground.
meanings.sent2: The baby elephant playfully sprayed water with its trunk.
meanings.sent3: The elephant's trunk wiggled comically as it tried to reach a high branch.
meanings.sent4: The trunk of the elephant was a versatile tool, helping it in various tasks.
meanings.sent5: The long trunk of the elephant swung gracefully as it walked through the savanna.

meanings.definition: The main part of the human body, not including the head, arms, or legs.
meanings.sent1: He placed the heavy box on the trunk of his body and carried it upstairs.
meanings.sent2: The weightlifter focused on strengthening his trunk for better balance.
meanings.sent3: The trunk of his body felt sore after a day of heavy lifting.
meanings.sent4: The trunk of his body supported him as he stood tall and proud.
meanings.sent5: The trunk of his body was covered in tattoos, each telling a different story.
